E|--x----x----x----x----x---|

Notes:
This is an edited version of Ver4, I fixed the mistakes. Check out my Youtube 
covers http://www.youtube.com/user/joshyboy152.

The song is in 4/4 time. All chords are played for a bar. Except whenever an Fsus chord
played and F chords is played for 2 beats then play Fsus for 2 beats.

Listen to the song in the Video to find out the strumming-pattern, it's pretty easy.

The chords are like bar chords except you use your thumb for the 6 string in this case
doesn't use his thumb or fret the high e string.

Scorpions - Still Loving You
Love at First Sting (1984)

Original recording is a bit sharp so it's somewhere between Gm and G#m pitchwise, but played as Gm.
The Comeblack re-recording (2011) is tuned down a 1/2 step so is in F#m.

All chords in the chorus/solo/outro sections can be played as power chords.
Tempo = c. 50 bpm or 100 bpm with a half-time feel, speed up slightly as the
           song progresses (tab is written as the latter).

(NOTES)

1) when a chord is followed by a !, it means that you do not strum the chord
but instead you play it in one quick downward motion.
2) when a chord is followed by a *, it means that the chord has to be plucked.
the plucking pattern is given below

(PLUCKING PATTERN)

The plucking progression for Dm, Am and G goes like this

     [ch]Dm[/ch]         [ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]
e|---1-----|---0-----|------------|
B|-----3---|-----1---|-----3------|
G|-2-----2-|-2-----2-|-0-----0----|
D|-0-------|-2-------|-0-------0--|
A|-0-------|-0-------|-2----------|
E|-0-------|-0-------|-3----------|

Or this

    [ch]Dm[/ch]         [ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]
e|---------|---------|---------|
B|-6-6-----|-5-5-----|-5-5-----|
G|-7---7---|-5---5---|-4---4---|
D|-7-----5-|-7-----7-|-5-----5-|
A|-5-------|-7-------|-5-------|
E|---------|-5-------|-3-------|     

The whistling bit can be played on the guitar but it doesn't sound too good.

e|----------------------------|
B|----0-1--1-1-------0-1-3-1--|
G|--2----------2-2-2----------|x2
D|----------------------------|
A|----------------------------|
E|----------------------------|

 The Dm,Am,G plucking is immediately picked up after the last note.

e|-----0-1-0---------------------|
B|-1-3---------------------------|
G|-------------------------------| 
D|-------------------------------| 
A|-------------------------------|
E|-------------------------------|

[Note]
Optimized to be played with Acoustic Guitars.
More depth with altered chords.
More harmony with letting the 1st and 2nd string open the whole song.
Good for live acoustic performance.
 
   Use these shapes for the chords
[ch]Asus2[/ch] (x02200)
C#m7  (x42100 or x46600)
[ch]Bsus4[/ch] (x24400)


   [PLS READ FIRST]
Don't really need to play the G#m chord all the time since its actually a passing chord.
But if you still want to play it, i suggest to play the bass only.
Simply use the middle finger to press the G# while still on the Bsus4 shape and it makes a G#m7+5 chord.
Also, its perfectly fine if you accidentally strummed the low E string every so often.
Removed the Intro and added one chord as Outro.

   Side note about [Outro]
Sounds fine either you jump straight to E to end it right away, or or follow my chords 
to bridge it out with Asus2 first and make it ends a bit slower.

[No Capo Needed]
